dialog.line: Dad, why is Will so grumpy these days?
Are you telling tales? Are you trying to get me on your side about something?
Oh Dad, you're just as grumpy as him! Don't be so suspicious.
Oh. Have I misjudged my favourite 9 year old?

I'm your only 9 year old so don't try to get round me that way. No really Dad, I know he's my older brother and everything and he's supposed to hate his little sister, but he's different from how he was. He seems really, I don't know, down.
Well, he's a teenager.
Dad, I'm not a baby. I know about that hormone stuff but I think it's different. He doesn't seem to have the friends he used to have.
So what do you think is up? You think he's really miserable about something?
Well, I dunno. I think he puts on a bit of an act when you're around. Sometimes when we're doing our homework he just stares into space and looks so unhappy it's like he's about to cry.
Uh huh. Do you say anything to him Justine?
Course. I tried tickling him. Last night I put a really funny picture on his computer so would see it as soon as he opened his emails. But he just deleted it.
Ok, Justine. You've been a really good sister. Come and have a hug.
Later Dad, you've got a bit of pasta in your beard.
So do you have any idea what's bothering Will? Is there something you're not telling me?
Well...
Come on honey, there is something isn't there?
Promise you won't say anything?
I can't promise that can I? If I need to do something then I need to do it. If you know something I should worry about you can't expect me to do nothing.

When I was putting that jpeg on his computer I saw he hardly had any emails from his friends. You know how he used to send and get about a million a day? There were two new ones though. I couldn't open them cos he'd know, but they looked really nasty.
How do you mean nasty? How could you tell?
I don't like to say, Dad, but in the 'subject' bit on the screen, one said the F word, then something else, then the N word...
